definition.name: Demo for pEPR - Extended Producer Responsibilities: register as a packaging waste reprocessor (SEPA)

components.content:
Use this form to apply for registration with the Environment Agency (EA) as a reprocessor of packaging waste.

**You must submit this form once for each packaging waste category you intend to register.**

The form will take around 60 minutes to complete. [Read what information you should have ready before you start.](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/packaging-waste-2026-registration-and-accreditation-process-for-reprocessors-and-exporters#apply-for-registration-as-a-reprocessor)

For information on how Defra and the environmental regulators (EA, NRW, DAERA, SEPA) process your personal data, please visit the [privacy notice on GOV.UK](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/extended-producer-responsibility-for-packaging-privacy-policy).

pages.title: Do you have an Organisation ID number?

components.title: Do you have an Organisation ID number?
components.name: aDpeKT
components.shortDescription: Do you have an org ID?

components.content:
To be able to register as a reprocessor of packaging waste you must first apply for an Organisation ID (Org ID). 

You can [apply for an Org ID with the Environment Agency](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/packaging-waste-2026-registration-and-accreditation-process-for-reprocessors-and-exporters#submit-your-organisation-details).

components.title: What is the name of your organisation?
components.name: DDVUrr

components.title: What is your Organisation ID (Org ID) number?
components.name: rJMICz
components.hint: Your Org ID number is a 6 digit number, for example 123456

components.title: What is your System Reference number?
components.name: DAcLmf
components.hint: The System Reference number was provided within the same email as the Org ID - it is 24 characters long

components.content: This is the person who the regulator can contact if they have any questions or queries regarding this application

pages.title: Packaging waste the site is authorised to accept and recycle

components.content:
You need to tell us all the materials the site has a permit or waste exemption to accept and recycle. 

The 'R' code is the classification of the reprocessing activity. These are in Annex 2 of the [Waste Framework Directive.](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A02008L0098-20240218)

components.content: You may have more than one waste exemption number. Add the details of one of them on this page and choose 'Continue'. On the next page choose 'Add another waste exemption' to add the next.

pages.title: What is your waste carrier, broker or dealer registration number?

components.hint: This must be an upper tier waste carrier, broker or dealer registration and is CBDU followed by a 4 to 6 digit number, for example CBDU123456

pages.title: Which packaging waste category are you registering?

components.title: Which packaging waste category are you registering?
components.name: dFPgaw
components.shortDescription: Packaging waste category to be registered
components.hint: You can only apply to register one material on each application  you can apply for another material category after youve submitted this application

pages.title: What process is used for recycling glass?

components.title: What process is used for recycling glass?
components.name: YMRnmp

pages.title: What type of suppliers do you receive this packaging waste category from?

components.title: What type of suppliers do you receive this packaging waste category from?
components.name: HFOWKa
components.hint: For example local council collections, direct from producer, material recovery facility

components.content:
Regulators need to know the mix of waste types and raw materials used in your recycling process.

Only include the tonnage that relates to the packaging waste category you are registering.

components.title: Are the tonnages for input actual or estimated figures?
components.name: VVwRDD

components.title: UK packaging waste
components.name: cyBcMz

components.title: Non-UK packaging waste
components.name: gGUQnN

components.title: Non-packaging waste
components.name: VSKoqK
components.hint: An input to the recycling process, but it's not packaging waste

pages.title: Raw material inputs for calendar year 2024

components.content:
Only include the tonnage that relates to the recycling process for the packaging waste category you are registering.

If you need to give details about more than one raw material, complete these questions for the first, choose 'Continue' then 'Add another raw material input' on the next page.

components.title: Raw material
components.name: hYwnjo
components.hint: Enter the name of the raw material used in your recycling process, for example water or starch

components.title: Raw material tonnage
components.name: dgypsb
components.hint: Enter whole tonnages

components.content: Only include the tonnage that relates to the packaging waste category you are registering.

components.title: Are the output tonnages actual or estimated figures?
components.name: slZDTV

components.title: Total tonnage of the packaging waste category sent to other sites for recycling
components.name: TTBOhH
components.hint: Material received but not recycled at your site

components.title: Total contaminants from recycling the packaging waste category
components.name: zWAYkP
components.hint: Contaminants removed from the material during recycling, including non-recyclable components or impurities

components.title: Total process loss from recycling the packaging waste category
components.name: sfMNQP
components.hint: For example, loss through material degradation or waste

components.content:
Only include the tonnage that relates to the recycling process for the packaging waste category you are registering.

If you need to give details about more than one product, complete these questions for the first, choose 'Continue' then 'Add another product from recycling' on the next page.

components.title: Products made from recycling
components.name: QCBNNY
components.hint: Enter the name of the product, for example milk bottles, food trays or cardboard boxes

components.title: Tonnage of product
components.name: CShkze
components.hint: Enter whole tonnages

pages.title: What is the plant and equipment used to recycle this packaging waste category?

components.title: What is the plant and equipment used to recycle this packaging waste category?
components.name: mVuNew
components.hint: You only need to enter the name of the equipment - we'll ask you more detail about how you use it in the sampling and inspection plan

components.content:
You need to provide a plan explaining how you determine the amount of UK packaging waste received for recycling at this site. This is called a sampling and inspection plan (SIP). 

Complete the [Packaging Reprocessor Sampling and Inspection Plan - Part 1: Registration](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/686cf3922557debd867cbddd/25_07_01_Doc__Reprocessor_Registration_SIP_.odt) template then upload it on this page.

components.title: Upload part 1 of your sampling and inspection plan
components.name: xddzIW
components.hint: You may also upload supporting documentation

components.content:
You must give the name of an 'approved person' who will be responsible for tasks on behalf of your organisation. This person must:

* apply for accreditation
* submit and verify data returns

##  Approved person's details

components.content:
If you want to keep a record of your submitted answers please print this page.

By submitting this application you confirm the information you provided is accurate.

**You may face enforcement action if the data is inaccurate.**

main.SoGzFb: Environmental permit or waste management licence,Installation or PPC permit,Waste exemption
main.HFOWKa: Local authorities, supermarkets, manufacturing companies, waste collection companies, materials recovery facilities (MRFs)
main.mVuNew: Optical sorting machine (Model XR-500), industrial crusher producing 10-40mm cullet, trommel screen (50mm aperture), magnetic separator, vibrating screens for grading, wash and rinse facility, rotary dryer, storage bunkers (50 tonne capacity), conveyor belt system (50m length), bag splitter, dust extraction system, weighbridge (60 tonne)
